Positive: A 6-month-old infant presents with frequent vomiting after feeding, coughing, gagging or choking during feeding, irritability or crying, and arching of the back during or after feedings. The infant is also experiencing poor weight gain and refusing to eat.
Negative: A 6-month-old infant does not show any symptoms of frequent vomiting after feeding, coughing, gagging or choking during feeding, irritability or crying, and arching of the back during or after feedings. The infant also has normal weight gain and does not refuse to eat.
